item.title: sports briefing | track and field: track coach contests 10-year suspension for balco ties
item.description: mark block, a track coach and agent, is appealing his 10-year doping-related suspension to the court of arbitration for sport.

item.title: cephalon rejects valeant's $5.7 billion takeover bid
item.description: cephalon, which has already rebuffed several private merger approaches by valeant in recent months, says the latest offer as more of the same.

item.title: toshiba to buy meter maker landis+gyr for $2.3 billion
item.description: japanese electronics manufacturer toshiba corp said on thursday it will buy unlisted swiss-based meter maker landis+gyr in a deal valued at $2.3 billion, including debt, in a bid to move into the promising overseas smart grid market.

item.title: heat 101, bulls 93: james's 35 points carry heat over bulls

item.description: veteran british rocker roger daltrey, a vehement critic of tv talent shows, once auditioned to be a judge on "american idol," according to rolling stone magazine.

item.title: winnipeg clears ticket hurdle in acquiring thrashers
item.description: winnipeg easily cleared an important hurdle in its effort to secure the relocation of the atlanta thrashers with the sale of 13,000 season tickets, the nhl said on saturday.

item.title: political memo: an arizona senate race waits to see if giffords emerges to run

item.title: venus williams will travel to germany for fed cup
